iti17:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti17:2.1.pli: “Sekhassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appattamānasassa anuttaraṃ yogakkhemaṃ patthayamānassa viharato bāhiraṃ aṅganti karitvā nāññaṃ ekaṅgampi samanupassāmi yaṃ evaṃ bahūpakāraṃ yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, kalyāṇamittatā.
iti17:2.1.eng: “Taking into account exterior factors, mendicants, I do not see a single one that is so very helpful as good friendship for a trainee mendicant who hasn’t achieved their heart’s desire, but lives aspiring to the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.

iti17:2.2.pli: Kalyāṇamitto, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāvetī”ti.
iti17:2.2.eng: A mendicant who has good friends gives up the unskillful and develops the skillful.”

iti17:4.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti17:4.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti18:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti18:2.1.pli: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanāhitāya bahujanāsukhāya bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṃ.
iti18:2.1.eng: “One thing, mendicants, arises in the world for the detriment and suffering of the people, against the people, for the harm, detriment, and suffering of gods and humans.

iti18:2.4.pli: Saṅghe kho pana, bhikkhave, bhinne aññamaññaṃ bhaṇḍanāni ceva honti, aññamaññaṃ paribhāsā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ parikkhepā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ pariccajanā ca honti.
iti18:2.4.eng: When the Saṅgha is split, they argue, insult, block, and forsake each other.

iti18:2.5.pli: Tattha appasannā ceva nappasīdanti, pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattaṃ hotī”ti.
iti18:2.5.eng: This doesn’t inspire confidence in those without it, and it causes some with confidence to change their minds.”

iti18:3.2.eng: in a place of loss, in hell.

iti18:3.3.eng: Taking a stand against the teaching,

iti18:3.4.eng: favoring factions, they ruin their sanctuary.

iti18:3.5.eng: After causing schism in a harmonious Saṅgha,

iti18:3.6.eng: they burn in hell for an eon.”

iti18:4.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti18:4.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti19:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti19:2.1.pli: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, loke uppajjamāno uppajjati bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.
iti19:2.1.eng: “One thing, mendicants, arises in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

iti19:2.4.pli: Saṅghe kho pana, bhikkhave, samagge na ceva aññamaññaṃ bhaṇḍanāni honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ paribhāsā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ parikkhepā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ pariccajanā honti.
iti19:2.4.eng: When the Saṅgha is in harmony, they don’t argue, insult, block, or forsake each other.

iti19:2.5.pli: Tattha appasannā ceva pasīdanti, pasannānañca bhiyyobhāvo hotī”ti.
iti19:2.5.eng: This inspires confidence in those without it, and increases confidence in those who have it.”

iti19:3.2.eng: as is support for those in harmony.

iti19:3.3.eng: Taking a stand on the teaching,

iti19:3.4.eng: favoring harmony, they ruin no sanctuary.

iti19:3.5.eng: After creating harmony in the Saṅgha,

iti19:3.6.eng: they rejoice in heaven for an eon.”

iti19:4.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti19:4.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti2:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti2:2.4.eng: Hate is the one thing. Give it up,

iti2:3.2.eng: beings go to a bad place.

iti2:3.6.eng: they never return to this world.”

iti2:4.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti2:4.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti20:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti20:2.1.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ paduṭṭhacittaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
iti20:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, when I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual whose mind is corrupted, I understand:

iti20:2.2.pli: ‘imamhi cāyaṃ samaye puggalo kālaṃ kareyya yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye’.
iti20:2.2.eng: ‘If this individual were to die right now, they would be cast down to hell.’

iti20:2.5.pli: Cetopadosahetu kho pana, bhikkhave, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjantī”ti.
iti20:2.5.eng: Corruption of mind is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”

iti20:4.2.eng: were to die at this time,

iti20:5.1.eng: That sort is cast down as surely

iti20:5.2.eng: as if they’d been carried off and put there.

iti20:5.3.eng: For corruption of mind is the reason

iti20:5.4.eng: sentient beings go to a bad place.”

iti20:6.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti20:6.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti21:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti21:2.1.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ekaccaṃ puggalaṃ pasannacittaṃ evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāmi:
iti21:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, when I’ve comprehended the mind of an individual whose mind is pure, I understand:

iti21:2.2.pli: ‘imamhi cāyaṃ samaye puggalo kālaṃ kareyya yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge’.
iti21:2.2.eng: ‘If this individual were to die right now, they would be raised up to heaven.’

iti21:2.5.pli: Cetopasādahetu kho pana, bhikkhave, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjantī”ti.
iti21:2.5.eng: Purity of mind is the reason why some sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”

iti21:4.2.eng: were to die at this time,

iti21:5.1.eng: That sort is raised up as surely

iti21:5.2.eng: as if they’d been carried and put there.

iti21:5.3.eng: For purity of mind is the reason

iti21:5.4.eng: sentient beings go to a good place.”

iti21:6.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti21:6.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti22:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti22:2.2.pli: Sukhassetaṃ, bhikkhave, adhivacanaṃ iṭṭhassa kantassa piyassa manāpassa yadidaṃ puññāni.
iti22:2.2.eng: For ‘good deeds’ is a term for happiness, for what is likable, desirable, and agreeable.

iti22:2.3.pli: Abhijānāmi kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, dīgharattaṃ katānaṃ puññānaṃ iṭṭhaṃ kantaṃ piyaṃ manāpaṃ vipākaṃ paccanubhūtaṃ.
iti22:2.3.eng: I recall undergoing for a long time the likable, desirable, and agreeable results of good deeds performed over a long time.

iti22:2.4.pli: Satta vassāni mettacittaṃ bhāvetvā satta saṃvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe nayimaṃ lokaṃ punarāgamāsiṃ.
iti22:2.4.eng: Having developed a mind of love for seven years, for seven eons of the cosmos contracting and expanding I didn’t return to this world again.

iti22:2.5.pli: Saṃvaṭṭamāne sudaṃ, bhikkhave, kappe ābhassarūpago homi;
iti22:2.5.eng: As the eon contracted I went to the realm of streaming radiance.

iti22:2.6.eng: As it expanded I was reborn in an empty mansion of divinity.

iti22:3.1.pli: Tatra sudaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmā homi mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī.
iti22:3.1.eng: There I was the Divinity, the Great Divinity, the vanquisher, the unvanquished, the universal seer, the wielder of power.

iti22:3.2.pli: Chattiṃsakkhattuṃ kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sakko ahosiṃ devānamindo;
iti22:3.2.eng: I was Sakka, lord of gods, thirty-six times.

iti22:3.3.pli: anekasatakkhattuṃ rājā ahosiṃ cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
iti22:3.3.eng: Many hundreds of times I was a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. My dominion extended to all four sides, I achieved stability in the country, and I possessed the seven treasures.

iti22:4.2.pli: ‘kissa nu kho me idaṃ kammassa phalaṃ, kissa kammassa vipāko, yenāhaṃ etarahi evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvo’ti?
iti22:4.2.eng: ‘Of what deed of mine is this the fruit and result, that I am now so mighty and powerful?’

iti22:4.4.pli: ‘tiṇṇaṃ kho me idaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ, tiṇṇaṃ kammānaṃ vipāko, yenāhaṃ etarahi evaṃmahiddhiko evaṃmahānubhāvoti, seyyathidaṃ—
iti22:4.4.eng: ‘It is the fruit and result of three kinds of deeds:

iti22:7.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti22:7.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti23:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti23:2.1.pli: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato ubho atthe samadhigayha tiṭṭhati—
iti23:2.1.eng: “This one thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated, secures equal benefits for both

iti23:2.2.eng: this life and lives to come.

iti23:2.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato ubho atthe samadhigayha tiṭṭhati—
iti23:2.5.eng: This is the one thing that, when developed and cultivated, secures equal benefits for both

iti23:2.6.eng: this life and lives to come.”

iti23:4.4.eng: they are said to be astute.”

iti23:5.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti23:5.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti24:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti24:2.1.pli: “Ekapuggalassa, bhikkhave, kappaṃ sandhāvato saṃsarato siyā evaṃ mahā aṭṭhikaṅkalo aṭṭhipuñjo aṭṭhirāsi yathāyaṃ vepullo pabbato, sace saṃhārako assa, sambhatañca na vinasseyyā”ti.
iti24:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, one person roaming and transmigrating for an eon would amass a heap of bones the size of this Mount Vepulla, if they were gathered together and not lost.”

iti24:3.1.eng: “If the bones of a single individual

iti24:3.2.eng: for a single eon were gathered up,

iti24:3.3.eng: they’d make a pile the size of a mountain:

iti24:4.1.eng: And this is declared to be

iti24:4.4.eng: near the Mountainfold of the Magadhans.

iti24:5.6.eng: that leads to the stilling of suffering.

iti24:6.1.eng: After roaming on seven times at most,

iti24:6.4.eng: with the ending of all fetters.”

iti24:7.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti24:7.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti25:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti25:2.1.pli: “Ekadhammaṃ atītassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa nāhaṃ tassa kiñci pāpakammaṃ akaraṇīyanti vadāmi.
iti25:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, for an individual person who transgresses in one thing, there is no bad deed they would not do, I say.

iti25:2.3.eng: It is this: telling a deliberate lie.”

iti25:3.4.eng: there is no evil they would not do.”

iti25:4.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti25:4.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti26:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti26:2.1.pli: “Evañce, bhikkhave, sattā jāneyyuṃ dānasaṃvibhāgassa vipākaṃ yathāhaṃ jānāmi, na adatvā bhuñjeyyuṃ, na ca nesaṃ maccheramalaṃ cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭheyya.
iti26:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, if sentient beings only knew, as I do, the fruit of giving and sharing, they would not eat without first giving, and the stain of stinginess would not occupy their minds.
iti26:2.1.comm: “A man who eats alone eats only sin” (Rig Veda 10.117.6, Manu 3.118).

iti26:2.2.pli: Yopi nesaṃ assa carimo ālopo carimaṃ kabaḷaṃ, tatopi na asaṃvibhajitvā bhuñjeyyuṃ, sace nesaṃ paṭiggāhakā assu.
iti26:2.2.eng: They would not eat without sharing even their last mouthful, their last morsel, so long as there was someone to receive it.

iti26:2.3.pli: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, sattā na evaṃ jānanti dānasaṃvibhāgassa vipākaṃ yathāhaṃ jānāmi, tasmā adatvā bhuñjanti, maccheramalañca nesaṃ cittaṃ pariyādāya tiṭṭhatī”ti.
iti26:2.3.eng: It is because sentient beings do not know, as I do, the fruit of giving and sharing, that they eat without first giving, and the stain of stinginess occupies their minds.”

iti26:3.4.eng: as taught by the great seer!

iti26:4.1.eng: Rid of the stain of stinginess,

iti26:4.3.eng: they would duly give to the noble ones,

iti26:4.4.eng: where a gift is very fruitful.

iti26:5.2.eng: to those worthy of a religious donation,

iti26:5.3.eng: after passing from the human realm,

iti26:6.1.eng: And when they have arrived there in heaven,

iti26:6.2.eng: they enjoy all the pleasures they desire.

iti26:7.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti26:7.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.

iti27:1.1.eng: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.

iti27:2.1.pli: “Yāni kānici, bhikkhave, opadhikāni puññakiriyavatthūni sabbāni tāni mettāya cetovimuttiyā kalaṃ nāgghanti soḷasiṃ.
iti27:2.1.eng: “Mendicants, of all the grounds for making worldly merit, none are worth a sixteenth part of the heart’s release by love.

iti27:2.2.pli: Mettāyeva tāni cetovimutti adhiggahetvā bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca.
iti27:2.2.eng: Surpassing them, the heart’s release by love shines and glows and radiates.

iti27:3.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, yā kāci tārakarūpānaṃ pabhā sabbā tā candiyā pabhāya kalaṃ nāgghanti soḷasiṃ, candapabhāyeva tā adhiggahetvā bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca;
iti27:3.1.eng: It’s like how the radiance of all the stars is not worth a sixteenth part of the moon’s radiance. Surpassing them, the moon’s radiance shines and glows and radiates.

iti27:3.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, yāni kānici opadhikāni puññakiriyavatthūni sabbāni tāni mettāya cetovimuttiyā kalaṃ nāgghanti soḷasiṃ, mettāyeva tāni cetovimutti adhiggahetvā bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca.
iti27:3.2.eng: In the same way, of all the grounds for making worldly merit, none are worth a sixteenth part of the heart’s release by love. Surpassing them, the heart’s release by love shines and glows and radiates.

iti27:4.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, vassānaṃ pacchime māse saradasamaye viddhe vigatavalāhake deve ādicco nabhaṃ abbhussakkamāno sabbaṃ ākāsagataṃ tamagataṃ abhivihacca bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca;
iti27:4.1.eng: It’s like the last month of the rainy season, in autumn, when the heavens are sunny and cloudless. And as the sun is rising to the firmament, having dispelled all the darkness of space, it shines and glows and radiates.

iti27:4.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, yāni kānici opadhikāni puññakiriyavatthūni sabbāni tāni mettāya cetovimuttiyā kalaṃ nāgghanti soḷasiṃ, mettāyeva tāni cetovimutti adhiggahetvā bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca.
iti27:4.2.eng: In the same way, of all the grounds for making worldly merit, none are worth a sixteenth part of the heart’s release by love. Surpassing them, the heart’s release by love shines and glows and radiates.

iti27:5.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ osadhitārakā bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati ca;
iti27:5.1.eng: It’s like how, at the crack of dawn, the Morning Star shines and glows and radiates.

iti27:5.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, yāni kānici opadhikāni puññakiriyavatthūni sabbāni tāni mettāya cetovimuttiyā kalaṃ nāgghanti soḷasiṃ, mettāyeva tāni cetovimutti adhiggahetvā bhāsate ca tapate ca virocati cā”ti.
iti27:5.2.eng: In the same way, of all the grounds for making worldly merit, none are worth a sixteenth part of the heart’s release by love. Surpassing them, the heart’s release by love shines and glows and radiates.”

iti27:7.1.eng: Loving just one creature with a hateless heart

iti27:7.4.eng: a noble one creates abundant merit.

iti27:8.1.eng: The royal potentates conquered this land

iti27:8.4.eng: the sacrifices of the ‘casting of the yoke-pin’, <j>the ‘royal soma drinking’, and the ‘unimpeded’.

iti27:9.1.eng: These are not worth a sixteenth part

iti27:9.2.eng: of the mind developed with love,

iti27:9.3.eng: as starlight cannot rival the moon.

iti27:10.1.eng: Don’t kill or cause others to kill,

iti27:10.2.eng: don’t conquer or encourage others to conquer,

iti27:10.3.eng: with love for all living creatures—

iti27:10.4.eng: you’ll have no enmity for anyone.”

iti27:11.1.pli: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
iti27:11.1.eng: This too is a matter that was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
